sentences.english: Serendipitous people are more fearless about trying something new.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾人們會更加勇於嘗試新鮮事物。

sentences.english: Private cars, like everything else, have more than one face.
sentences.chinese: 像任何事物一樣，私家車也有多面性。

sentences.english: Do the five or fifty and find out what it's talking about.
sentences.chinese: 請做那5或50的練習，並找出它所談論的事物。

sentences.english: We don't change things out of personal prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲個人成見而改變事物的本來面目。

sentences.english: Be open to new ideas, new ways of seeing things and new styles.
sentences.chinese: 要開放地接納新觀點，看事物的新角度，新風格。

sentences.english: We can not only become detached by realizing the true nature of things.
sentences.chinese: 只有斷去這些關聯，我們才能認清事物的本質。

sentences.english: So, we find that, in fact, something exists; it has no shape.
sentences.chinese: 我們便會發現，有事物存在，它沒有形狀。

sentences.english: They are famous for the lifelike reality of their paintings.
sentences.chinese: 他們因對事物的描繪幾乎接近真實而出名。

sentences.english: You should keep these emotional stimulators in a place where you can see them.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把這些能激勵自己的事物放在看得見的地方。

sentences.english: It resides in the particular things thathe delighted to record.
sentences.chinese: 它就棲身於塞林格滿懷欣喜記錄下來的那些事物中。

sentences.english: Opposite forces represent two qualities, not alike , that are contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 奇正兩字，是代表着二種不同性質的事物的矛盾。

sentences.english: The maintaining power means that the property of an object has an unshakeable internal power.
sentences.chinese: 定力是指事物性質具有不可動搖的內力。

sentences.english: He who despises small things seldom grows rich.
sentences.chinese: 蔑視小事物者難成富有者。

sentences.english: When 6. free times the assistance warehouse tube processes the warehouse thing.
sentences.chinese: 空閒時協助倉管員處理倉庫事物。

sentences.english: And, said Coffey, education can be "a proxy for many things".
sentences.chinese: 科菲說，接受過教育能在“很多事物上表現出來”。

sentences.english: On the contrary, things are always moving forward in its twisty way.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，事物的發展總是曲折着前進的。

definition: the objective world (as opposed to empirical observation)
